授業目的: 英文シラバスをご参照ください。
到達目標: 英文シラバスをご参照ください。
授業の概要・背景: In this class we will explore the interconnected concepts of diversity and inclusion. We will start by exploring the topic through personal experiences. Next, we will explore different sets of diversity and inclusion issues in the contexts of race and ethnicity, ability and disability, gender, sexuality and gender identification, and socioeconomic status. In the last part of the semester we will focus on those diversity issues in the context of education.
授業方法: This course will require active participation. The course instructor will introduce ideas, examples and key concepts, but students will be asked to read the chapter before the class and do group work in class to take the content further.

第2回: Personal experiences: Mabel Cooper's life story
第4回: Brushed behind the bike shed: working-class lesbians' experiences of school
第5回: Types of Inequalities: The context: a problem of gender
第7回: Bad Math: Equating Culture and Class [race]
第9回: Rethinking the history of inclusive education in Japan [disability]
第10回: The development of a new thinking: Has classroom teaching served its day?
第11回: The politics of education for all
第12回: Why it remains important to take children's rights seriously?
第13回: Including all of our lives: renewing the social model of disability
